com.vectorprint.report.running

Class ThreadSafeReportBuilder<RD extends ReportDataHolder>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vectorprint.report.running.ReportRunner<RD>
      • com.vectorprint.report.running.ThreadSafeReportBuilder<RD>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReportBuilder<String[],RD>

    public class ThreadSafeReportBuilder<RD extends ReportDataHolder>
extends ReportRunner<RD>
    A Threadsafe reportbuilder; you can safely call ReportRunner.buildReport(java.lang.String[]) at the same time from different threads on an instance of this class. When threads are reused (pooled) unwanted access to thread variables may occur. When an environment variable REPORT_CONFIG is set it is assumed to point to the base url where property files are found, otherwise CONFIG_URL is used}.
    Author:
    Eduard Drenth at VectorPrint.nl
    See Also:
    MultiThreadProps

        public ThreadSafeReportBuilder(boolean allowEmptyValues,
                       boolean trimKeyValues)
                        throws IOException,
                               com.vectorprint.VectorPrintException,
                               com.vectorprint.configuration.parser.ParseException
        constructor tries to figure out where the configs are using ReportConstants#REPORT_CONFIG and ReportConstants#CONFIG_URL. Uses DEFAULTPROPERTYURLS to load settings.
        Parameters:
        allowEmptyValues - when true allow empty values for properties
        trimKeyValues - when true trim keys and values for properties
        Throws:
        IOException
